layer.name: Responsibility
layer.definition: The state or fact of having a duty to deal with something; owning what is yours to handle without blame-shifting or victimhood.

questions.text: I take responsibility for what I put into my body — food, drink, and substances are my choices.
I own that my sleep and rest are my responsibility to prioritize and protect.
I don't blame my schedule, family demands, or work for poor nutrition or inadequate sleep — I make choices within constraints.
I recognize that my physical environment (clean space, organization, reduced toxins) is mine to maintain.
questions.principle: Clean your room; own your space

questions.text: I take ownership of creating conditions that allow my body to recover and thrive, rather than just coping with chronic depletion.
